API DocumentationAll Packages | All Classes | Index | FramesNo Frames
Class JSInterfaceProperties | Methods
 
Packageaw.external
Classpublic class JSInterface

It’s the main class of JSInterface library, it contains the most necessary methods for interaction with JavaScript environment. This class contains “shortcut” methods for frequently used operations, such as page title changing, working with Cookie or loading CSS and JavaScript files. Before starting working with the library make sure that it was initialized JSInterface.initialize() method. Initialization is necessary to integrate the necessary JavaScript code to the HTML page for the JSInterface to be able to operate correctly.


Example
Example: 
 package {
 import aw.external.JSInterface;
 import aw.external.jsinterface.JSDynamic;
 import aw.external.jsinterface.objects.JSHTMLElement;
 
 import flash.display.Sprite;
 [SWF(width="20", height="20")]
 public class BodyOnClickExample extends Sprite{
  public function BodyOnClickExample():void{
   super();
   JSInterface.initialize(this);
   JSInterface.document.body.onclick = this.onclickHandler;
   var body:JSHTMLElement = JSDynamic.convert(JSInterface.document.body, JSHTMLElement);
   body.onclick();
   trace(JSInterface.document.links.length);
  }
  protected function onclickHandler():void{
   trace(' HTML Click! ');
  }
 }
}

Property detail
allowJavaScriptAccessproperty
public static var allowJavaScriptAccess:Boolean = false

The function that processes errors that occurred beyond the request from Flash Player. Such errors can occur during execution of JavaScript functions called from Flash Player by time-out (for example, using JSInterface.callLater() method).

availableproperty 
available:Boolean  [read-only]

Returns TRUE if you can use JSInterface. This will occur if application will run in browser with enabled ExternalInterface.

Implementation
    public static function get available():Boolean

exceptionHandlerproperty 
public static var exceptionHandler:Function

The function that processes errors that occurred beyond the request from Flash Player. Such errors can occur during execution of JavaScript functions called from Flash Player by time-out (for example, using JSInterface.callLater() method).

Return TRUE if JSInterface is initialized.

aw.external.jsinterface.objects.JSNavigator
redirectFlashExceptionsproperty 
public static var redirectFlashExceptions:Boolean = true

It allows access to Flash Player objects from JavaScript environment. If you set it as TRUE, you get a possibility to create and call for objects located in the Flash Player environment. If the value is FALSE, then the access to objects from Flash Player environment is limited to objects transferred to JavaScript in advance.

redirectJavaScriptExceptionsproperty 
public static var redirectJavaScriptExceptions:Boolean = true

Shows the necessity to duplicate JavaScript errors in Flash environment. Such errors can occur upon wrongful acts (calling for a non-existing methods) initiated by Flash Player environment.

rootproperty 
root:DisplayObject  [read-write]

Root object of DisplayObject hierarchy

Implementation
    public static function get root():DisplayObject
    public function set root(value:DisplayObject):void
stageproperty 
stage:Stage  [read-write]

Current Stage object.

Implementation
    public static function get stage():Stage
    public function set stage(value:Stage):void
traceExceptionOnlyproperty 
public static var traceExceptionOnly:Boolean = true

Instead of throwing error will show error description in OUTPUT window, using trace() command.

windowproperty 
window:JSWindow  [read-only]

Reference to the JavaScript window object. This object is used in JavaScript, as a global and globally declared JavaScript functions and properties will be available through it, as its methods and properties

Implementation
    public static function get window():JSWindow

See also

callLater()method
public static function callLater(obj:*, propName:String, args:Array = null, func:Function = null, timeout:uint = 1):void

Call the JavaScript method by timeout

Parameters
obj:* — The object containing the method
 
propName:String — Method name
 
args:Array (default = null) — Arguments list
 
func:Function (default = null) — Function into which will return the result of the JavaScript function
 
timeout:uint (default = 1) — Time in milliseconds

initialize()method 
public static function initialize(arg:* = null, allowJSAccess:Boolean = false):void

Initialize JSInterface.

Parameters
arg:* (default = null) — Any object of DisplayObject type with access to Stage, LoaderInfo of the program or URL line of the program. This parameter allows finding the HTML-object of the program in the DOM-tree of the HTML-page, if no ID for the Flash Player HTML-object has been set. In case of transferring an object of DisplayObject or LoaderInfo type related to Stage the properties JSInterface.stage and JSInterface.root, necessary for allowing access from JavaScript environment to Flash Player environment, will be filled in automatically.
 
allowJSAccess:Boolean (default = false) — Enables access from JavaScript environment into Flash Player environment.

Example
Initialization example: 
package {
 import aw.external.JSInterface;
 
 public class Test extends Sprite{
  public function Test():void{
   super();
   JSInterface.initialize(this, true);
  }
 }
}

loadCSS()method 
public static function loadCSS(url:String, func:Function = null, type:String = ""):JSHTMLElement

Load CSS file into the HTML document

Parameters
url:String — File URL
 
func:Function (default = null) — Function which will be called when load complete. In a browser, Fire Fox is not called onload event, so to catch the complete of loading in such a way is impossible, and this function will not be called.
 
type:String (default = "") — TYPE attribute value of LINK tag, if not specified, the default will be used - "text/css"

Returns
JSHTMLElement — JSHTMLElement HTML object of created LINK tag

See also

aw.external.jsinterface.objects.JSHTMLElement
loadJavaScript()method 
public static function loadJavaScript(url:String, func:Function = null, type:String = ""):JSHTMLElement

Load JavaScript file into the HTML document

Parameters
url:String — File URL
 
func:Function (default = null) — Function which will be called when load complete
 
type:String (default = "") — TYPE attribute value of SCRIPT tag, if not specified, the default will be used - "text/javascript"

Returns
JSHTMLElement — JSHTMLElement HTML object of created SCRIPT tag

See also

aw.external.jsinterface.objects.JSHTMLElement
pushCSS()method 
public static function pushCSS(style:String, type:String = ""):JSHTMLElement

Adds new STYLE tag with content from "style" argument into HEAD section of HTML document

Parameters
style:String — CSS Style definitions
 
type:String (default = "") — Content of "type" argument of STYLE tag, by default is "text/css"

Returns
JSHTMLElement — Created tag object

See also

aw.external.jsinterface.objects.JSHTMLElement
pushJavaScript()method 
public static function pushJavaScript(code:String, type:String = "", asVirual:Boolean = false):JSHTMLElement

Adds new SCRIPT tag with content from "code" argument into HEAD section of HTML document

Parameters
code:String — JavaScript code
 
type:String (default = "") — Content of "type" argument of SCRIPT tag, by default is "text/javascript"
 
asVirual:Boolean (default = false) — If TRUE, will NOT add new SCRIPT tag and will return NULL

Returns
JSHTMLElement — Created tag object

See also

aw.external.jsinterface.objects.JSHTMLElement
removeCookie()method 
public static function removeCookie(name:*, path:String = "/", domain:String = "", secure:Boolean = false):void

Removes cookie

Parameters
name:*
 
path:String (default = "/")
 
domain:String (default = "")
 
secure:Boolean (default = false)
setCookie()method 
public static function setCookie(name:*, value:Date, date:String = null, path:String = "/", domain:Boolean, secure:* = false):void

Setup cookie

Parameters
name:* — Cookie name
 
value:Date — Cookie value
 
date:String (default = null) — Expiration date
 
path:String (default = "/") — Path on which the cookie will be available
 
domain:Boolean — Domain for which cookie value is available
 
secure:* (default = false) — If TRUE, a cookie will be sent only via HTTPS
